intro: Staehelina fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered starwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, oblong seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Staehelina fasciculata is often found in shrublands and is adapted to tolerate salt spray and arid conditions.
